It‚Äôs finally time: MSFS A-Z starts today! ‚úàÔ∏è

After the teaser last week, I‚Äôm really excited to get this series off the ground. Episode 1 drops later today, marking the official start of our full A-to-Z run through Microsoft Flight Simulator.

Whether you‚Äôve been flying for years or just finished your first tutorial, this series is designed to be a practical, step-by-step guide to mastering the sim.

When: Today at 17:00 UTC+1

What: The very first letter... and the perfect foundation for everything to come.

The Weekly Schedule: 
‚úÖ Tuesday: New Episode drops 
‚úÖ Wednesday: Next topic revealed

I‚Äôve put a lot of work into the structure of these videos to keep them focused and useful. Can‚Äôt wait to see what you think of the premiere. See you in the skies! ‚úàÔ∏èüî•

Episode 2: "B" is for Bearing! ‚úàÔ∏è

We‚Äôre keeping the momentum going. After kicking things off last week, it‚Äôs time to tackle the letter B.

Navigation can get complicated quickly, so today‚Äôs episode is all about "Bearing." We‚Äôre stripping away the jargon to show you how to actually use bearings to stay on track, whether you‚Äôre flying a Cessna or a 737.

Watch it here at 17:00 UTC+1 tomorrow.

What we‚Äôre covering:

- the different types of bearing
- the effect on the instruments using demo's
- useful formula's related to bearing

One letter down, 25 to go. Let's get to work! üî•

The TBM 930 "Rocket" drops TODAY at 17:00 (UTC+1)! üõ´

We‚Äôre moving from the taxiway to the flight levels in today's episode. If you‚Äôve ever struggled to keep the TBM on the centerline during takeoff, or wondered why your engine keeps overheating during the climb, this is the one you can‚Äôt miss.

What we‚Äôre mastering today:

- The torque roll: How to handle 850HP without ending up in the grass.
- FLC mode: The "pro" way to use the G3000 autopilot for a smooth climb.
- Cruise at FL310: Managing fuel and pressurization at 31,000 feet.

I‚Äôve attached the V-Speed & Climb Profile cheat sheet below. Download it now so you‚Äôre ready to fly as soon as the video goes live!

üïí Global Release Times:

16:00 (UTC+0 / GMT)
17:00 (UTC+1 / Amsterdam)
11:00 (UTC-5 / New York)
08:00 (UTC-8 / Los Angeles)

See you at FL310! ‚úàÔ∏èüí®

‚úàÔ∏è MSFS A‚ÄëZ Episode 3: C is for Cold and Dark! ‚úàÔ∏è

Our alphabetical journey through Microsoft Flight Simulator 2024 continues! Next week, we‚Äôre tackling the ultimate immersion booster and the first step every real-world pilot takes‚Äîmastering the Cold and Dark startup.

If you‚Äôve been spawning directly on the runway with the engines already roaring, you‚Äôre missing out on the most satisfying part of the simulation. This episode is designed to take you from "button-masher" to "systems-pro," showing you exactly how to bring a dead aircraft to life.

What‚Äôs on the flight plan for Episode 3:

- The Power-Up: Understanding the flow from Battery and APU to full Engine Ignition.
- The 2024 walkaround: How to use the brand-new walkaround mode to prep your airframe before you even climb inside.
- Featured aircraft demo: A step-by-step startup guide for the DHC CL-415, including how to manage those massive turboprops.
- Pro-Tips: How to avoid a "Hot Start" and the common mistakes that leave pilots stranded at the gate.

üìÖ Release date: Tuesday, January 20th üïî Time: 17:00 UTC+1

Series schedule: 
üîÑ New MSFS A‚ÄëZ episode every Tuesday 
üì¢ Next topic revealed every Wednesday

Stop taking the shortcut and start experiencing the realism of a true flight deck. I can't wait to see your "first start" stories in the comments next Tuesday!

Blue skies and happy flying! ‚úàÔ∏èüî•

Episode 3: "C" is for Cold and Dark! ‚ùÑÔ∏è



We‚Äôre keeping the momentum going! We‚Äôve covered Ailerons and Bearings, and now it‚Äôs time to tackle the letter C.


Starting an aircraft properly is about more than just pressing a button. Today, we are using the massive Canadair CL-415 to demonstrate the full "Cold and Dark" procedure.

We are going beyond the default checklist (which misses some critical steps!) to show you how to bring this beast to life, from the frozen exterior to the warm hum of the engines.

Watch it here at 17:00 UTC+1 tomorrow.

What we‚Äôre covering:

- What does it mean and how can you start cold and dark
- External walkaround (Removing Covers)
- CL-415 cockpit prep (Dark to Light)
- Engine start procedure (The "Warm" Up)
- Plus: A special surprise at the very end! üéÅ

Two letters down, 23 to go. Let's get to work! üî•

Don‚Äôt Fly Blind! Master TBM 930 weather radar & VNAV drops TODAY at 17:00 (UTC+1)! ‚õàÔ∏èüì°

We are stepping into the "High-Altitude Office" today to master the systems that turn the TBM 930 into a true all-weather machine. If you‚Äôve ever felt overwhelmed by a sudden ATC diversion or wondered if you‚Äôre actually reading your weather radar correctly, this episode is your new flight manual.

What we‚Äôre mastering today:

- GWX 70 Radar: How to "slice" through storms and manage Tilt/Gain so you never fly into a cell by mistake.

- Mid-Air Amendments: The "Direct-To" bezel trick for handling ATC diversions like a seasoned pro.

- VNAV & TOD: No more guessing your descent. We‚Äôre setting up the G3000 to capture that perfect 3-degree path automatically.

Plus: Stick around for the "Nice to Know" segment where we look at how the TBM 930 actually beat a record held by the legendary Chuck Yeager.

üïí Global Release Times: 16:00 (UTC+0 / GMT) 17:00 (UTC+1 / Amsterdam) 11:00 (UTC-5 / New York) 08:00 (UTC-8 / Los Angeles)

Stop being a passenger‚Äîstart being a manager. See you in the clouds! ‚úàÔ∏è‚õàÔ∏è

Some fun facts after installing AIRAC cycle 2408 and reimporting it in LittleNavMap:

- 41330 airports (might include some community add-ons)
- 4900 VOR 
- 4215 ILS
- 5110 NDB
- markers 1418
- waypoints 256287
- airspaces 41668

Numbers might be different in your case since it also scans the community folder which contains the Navigraph NavData.

For a full review of the update and what has been included check the video below:
Waving goodbye to Portugal, next stop Morocco

üöÄ New Video Series Alert: Microsoft Flight Simulator Quiz Questions! ‚úàÔ∏è

Hey Flight Sim enthusiasts! üåü



I‚Äôm thrilled to announce a brand-new category of videos on my channel: Quiz Questions! üéâ These videos are packed with fun and challenging questions related to Microsoft Flight Simulator. Whether you‚Äôre a seasoned pilot or just starting your virtual flying journey, there‚Äôs something for everyone.


What‚Äôs in store?


- Flight Simulator History: Test your knowledge on the evolution of this iconic simulator.
- Keyboard Shortcuts: How well do you know your way around the cockpit controls?
- Flight Simulator Versions: From the classics to the latest releases, see how much you remember!

I invite you all to watch these videos, challenge yourself, and most importantly, have fun! Your feedback is incredibly valuable to me, so please leave your thoughts and suggestions in the comments. Let me know which topics you enjoyed the most and what you‚Äôd like to see in future quizzes.


Thank you for being such an amazing community. Your support means the world to me! üåç


Happy flying and quizzing! üõ´üß†
Flying parallel to the Portuguese coastline on my way to GMAD using the A320 V2 with Easyjet livery

I'm thrilled to express my heartfelt gratitude to each one of you for subscribing to my channel! Your support is the driving force that fuels my passion for crafting new and exciting content. We're on the brink of reaching 4,000 subscribers‚Äîa remarkable milestone that heralds our collective journey towards the 5,000 mark. If you know fellow simulation enthusiasts, friends, or colleagues, I encourage you to spread the word about this channel!


Moreover, if there's a facet of MSFS that you're curious about but haven't found a video on, I'm all ears. Drop a comment with your suggestions, and I might just create a video tailored to your interests. Your input is invaluable, and together, we can explore the vast skies of MSFS. Let's soar to new heights! üöÄüåü

‚úàÔ∏è MSFS A‚ÄëZ Episode 2: B is for Bearing! ‚úàÔ∏è

Our alphabetical journey through Microsoft Flight Simulator continues! Next week, we‚Äôre diving into one of the most important pillars of navigation‚Äîunderstanding your Bearings.

If you‚Äôve ever felt "lost" looking at an ADF needle or wondered why your VOR radial doesn't match your heading, this episode is designed to make everything click. We‚Äôre moving past the "magenta line" and learning how to truly navigate the cockpit.

What‚Äôs on the flight plan for Episode 2:

- The "Big Three": Understanding True, Magnetic, and Relative bearings.
- The math made easy: How to calculate your position without stress.
- VOR mastery: How bearings and radials work together in the sim.

Practical demos: real-world techniques you can use in MSFS immediately.

üìÖ Release Date: Tuesday, January 13th üïî Time: 17:00 UTC+1

Series schedule: üîÑ New MSFS A‚ÄëZ episode every Tuesday üì¢ Next topic revealed every Wednesday

Get ready to sharpen your navigation fundamentals and make VOR flying feel effortless. Looking forward to seeing you all in the comments next Tuesday!

Blue skies and happy flying! ‚úàÔ∏èüî•
